quotes.text: Happiness is dependent on self-discipline. We are the biggest obstacles to our own happiness. It is much easier to do battle with society and with others than to fight our own nature.
quotes.author: Dennis Prager

quotes.text: People must help one another it is nature's law.
quotes.author: Jean de La Fontaine

quotes.text: Limited in his nature, infinite in his desire, man is a fallen god who remembers heaven.
quotes.author: Alphonse de Lamartine

quotes.text: Your body is the church where Nature asks to be reverenced.
quotes.author: Marquis de Sade

quotes.text: The primary and most beautiful of Nature's qualities is motion, which agitates her at all times, but this motion is simply a perpetual consequence of crimes, she conserves it by means of crimes only.
quotes.author: Marquis de Sade

quotes.text: The protean nature of the computer is such that it can act like a machine or like a language to be shaped and exploited.
quotes.author: Alan Kay

quotes.text: I'll walk where my own nature would be leading: It vexes me to choose another guide.
quotes.author: Emily Bronte

quotes.text: People who don't see their nature and imagine they can practice thoughtlessness all the time are lairs and fools.
quotes.author: Bodhidharma

quotes.text: Becoming emancipated at 14, my life wasn't normal. I didn't have to go to school, so I didn't. I was rebellious by nature. I spent my 20s focusing on my company, Flower Films, and producing movies. Now that I'm almost 30, I would like to try other things in lie. I'm crazy about photography, and I want to take an art history class.
quotes.author: Drew Barrymore

quotes.text: I thoroughly enjoy getting away from the game and going out fishing because it's so relaxing, so quiet and peaceful. I mean, there's no noise other than nature - and it's so different from what I do in a tournament situation that it just eases my mind.
quotes.author: Tiger Woods

quotes.text: Whether we and our politicians know it or not, Nature is party to all our deals and decisions, and she has more votes, a longer memory, and a sterner sense of justice than we do.
quotes.author: Wendell Berry

quotes.text: There's something in human nature, the trying-to-get-on-with-it quality of people, the struggle to maintain or keep the show going can be exhausting.
quotes.author: Greg Kinnear

quotes.text: Physics does not change the nature of the world it studies, and no science of behavior can change the essential nature of man, even though both sciences yield technologies with a vast power to manipulate the subject matters.
quotes.author: Pope Paul VI

quotes.text: Nature is commonplace. Imitation is more interesting.
quotes.author: Gertrude Stein

quotes.text: An artist must possess Nature. He must identify himself with her rhythm, by efforts that will prepare the mastery which will later enable him to express himself in his own language.
quotes.author: Henri Matisse

quotes.text: Human intelligence may not be the best trick nature has to offer.
quotes.author: Bryant H. McGill

quotes.text: I consider it useless and tedious to represent what exists, because nothing that exists satisfies me. Nature is ugly, and I prefer the monsters of my fancy to what is positively trivial.
quotes.author: Charles Baudelaire

quotes.text: We all dream. We dream vividly, depending on our nature. Our existence is beyond our explanation, whether we believe in God or we have religion or we're atheist.
quotes.author: Anthony Hopkins

quotes.text: To find a Buddha all you have to do is see your nature.
quotes.author: Bodhidharma

quotes.text: Art is contemplation. It is the pleasure of the mind which searches into nature and which there divines the spirit of which nature herself is animated.
quotes.author: Auguste Rodin

quotes.text: Parents of recovered children, and I've met hundreds, all share the same experience of doubters and deniers telling us our child must have never even had autism or that the recovery was simply nature's course. We all know better, and frankly we're too busy helping other parents to really care.
quotes.author: Jenny McCarthy

quotes.text: Our job is to represent the truth of human nature, whether you're playing a tender love story that's set in a coffee shop or whether you're in 'The Avengers,' which is set in a Manhattan which is exploding.
quotes.author: Tom Hiddleston

quotes.text: Your basic person wants to talk about material culture, internet culture. I think about God, cats, nature.
quotes.author: Billy Corgan

quotes.text: Man is a creative retrospection of nature upon itself.
quotes.author: Karl Wilhelm Friedrich Schlegel

quotes.text: He who does not become familiar with nature through love will never know her.
quotes.author: Karl Wilhelm Friedrich Schlegel

quotes.text: I think the destructive, vicious, negative nature of much of the news media makes it harder to govern this country, harder to attract decent people to run for public office.
quotes.author: Newt Gingrich

quotes.text: There is a very remarkable inclination in human nature to bestow on external objects the same emotions which it observes in itself, and to find every where those ideas which are most present to it.
quotes.author: David Hume

quotes.text: Nature, who for the perfect maintenance of the laws of her general equilibrium, has sometimes need of vices and sometimes of virtues, inspires now this impulse, now that one, in accordance with what she requires.
quotes.author: Marquis de Sade

quotes.text: Part of making any endeavour is that each one has its own special problems. It's the nature of the process.
quotes.author: Martin Scorsese

quotes.text: Nature is the art of God.
quotes.author: Dante Alighieri

quotes.text: By nature I'm not a brooder.
quotes.author: Hugh Jackman

quotes.text: I have two children and it's amazing how in tune they are with nature, with light, with smells, with time.
quotes.author: Hugh Jackman

quotes.text: That's all about the natural order of things, the idea of nature protecting children but also children protecting nature.
quotes.author: Hugh Jackman

quotes.text: I know I'm not known as method. By nature I'm not a brooder. What I continue to use is a mixture of the English school, which is traditionally outside-in, and the more American way of working from the inside out.
quotes.author: Hugh Jackman

quotes.text: Chaos was the law of nature Order was the dream of man.
quotes.author: Henry Adams

quotes.text: Nature is indifferent to the survival of the human species, including Americans.
quotes.author: Adlai E. Stevenson

quotes.text: Nature is at work. Character and destiny are her handiwork. She gives us love and hate, jealousy and reverence. All that is ours is the power to choose which impulse we shall follow.
quotes.author: David Seabury

quotes.text: Marriage is an institution fits in perfect harmony with the laws of nature whereas systems of slavery and segregation were designed to brutally oppress people and thereby violated the laws of nature.
quotes.author: Jack Kingston

quotes.text: No tendency is quite so strong in human nature as the desire to lay down rules of conduct for other people.
quotes.author: William Howard Taft

quotes.text: If you can kill animals, the same attitude can kill human beings. The mentality is the same which exploits nature and which creates wars.
quotes.author: Satish Kumar

quotes.text: Living in Cambridge, with nature and everything, it's so clean.
quotes.author: Syd Barrett

quotes.text: Nature never makes any blunders, when she makes a fool she means it.
quotes.author: Archibald Alexander

quotes.text: Once you see your nature, sex is basically immaterial.
quotes.author: Bodhidharma

quotes.text: Human beings are accustomed to think of intellect as the power of having and controlling ideas and of ability to learn as synonymous with ability to have ideas. But learning by having ideas is really one of the rare and isolated events in nature.
quotes.author: Edward Thorndike

quotes.text: We are a people that have always celebrated other people's success so long as we always had the opportunity to meet that success ourselves. That is the American nature. That is the American character. That is one of the things that makes us different from the rest of the world. And I'm afraid we could lose that or are on the verge of losing that.
quotes.author: Marco Rubio

quotes.text: It's not in our nature. Americans have never been a people that drive through a nice neighborhood and say, 'Oh, I hate the people who live in these nice houses.'
quotes.author: Marco Rubio

quotes.text: We all need to look into the dark side of our nature - that's where the energy is, the passion. People are afraid of that because it holds pieces of us we're busy denying.
quotes.author: Sue Grafton

quotes.text: Nature makes boys and girls lovely to look upon so they can be tolerated until they acquire some sense.
quotes.author: William Lyon Phelps

quotes.text: There is a great deal of human nature in man.
quotes.author: Charles Kingsley

quotes.text: Loki in 'Thor' is the most incredible springboard into a sort of excavation of the darker aspects of human nature. So that was thrilling, coming back knowing that I'd built the boat and now I could set sail into choppier waters.
quotes.author: Tom Hiddleston

quotes.text: While day by day the overzealous student stores up facts for future use, he who has learned to trust nature finds need for ever fewer external directions. He will discard formula after formula, until he reaches the conclusion: Let nature take its course.
quotes.author: Larry Bird

quotes.text: Nature's great masterpiece, an elephant the only harmless great thing.
quotes.author: John Donne

quotes.text: I am not going to claim that modern anarchism has any direct relation to Roman jurisprudence but I do claim that it has its basis in the laws of nature rather than in the state of nature.
quotes.author: Herbert Read

quotes.text: What constitutes a real, live human being is more of a mystery than ever these days, and men each one of whom is a valuable, unique experiment on the part of nature are shot down wholesale.
quotes.author: Hermann Hesse

quotes.text: That's the nature of women, not to love when we love them, and to love when we love them not.
quotes.author: Miguel de Cervantes

quotes.text: This is a war universe. War all the time. That is its nature. There may be other universes based on all sorts of other principles, but ours seems to be based on war and games.
quotes.author: William Burroughs

quotes.text: Man masters nature not by force but by understanding. This is why science has succeeded where magic failed: because it has looked for no spell to cast over nature.
quotes.author: Jacob Bronowski

quotes.text: The nature of rumor is known to all.
quotes.author: Tertullian

quotes.text: I like my home and I like the nature.
quotes.author: Billy Corgan

quotes.text: Man is the miracle in nature. God Is the One Miracle to man.
quotes.author: Jean Ingelow

quotes.text: God is each truly and exalted thing, therefore the individual himself to the highest degree. But are not nature and the world individuals?
quotes.author: Karl Wilhelm Friedrich Schlegel

quotes.text: Humans have certain properties and characteristics which are intrinsic to them, just as every other organism does. That's human nature.
quotes.author: Noam Chomsky

quotes.text: As I grew older, I realized that it was much better to insist on the genuine forms of nature, for simplicity is the greatest adornment of art.
quotes.author: Albrecht Durer

quotes.text: Societies have always been shaped more by the nature of the media by which men communicate than by the content of the communication.
quotes.author: Marshall McLuhan

quotes.text: Disease is the retribution of outraged Nature.
quotes.author: Hosea Ballou

quotes.text: I believe it is in my nature to dance by virtue of the beat of my heart, the pulse of my blood and the music in my mind.
quotes.author: Robert Fulghum

quotes.text: By its very nature the beautiful is isolated from everything else. From beauty no road leads to reality.
quotes.author: Hannah Arendt

quotes.text: For all of nature's wonder and beauty, it is also hostile and unpredictable.
quotes.author: Liam Neeson

quotes.text: Although I'm an atheist who believes only in great nature, I recognize the spiritual richness and grandeur of the Roman Catholicism in which I was raised.
quotes.author: Camille Paglia

quotes.text: Philosophy would render us entirely Pyrrhonian, were not nature too strong for it.
quotes.author: David Hume

quotes.text: Human Nature is the only science of man and yet has been hitherto the most neglected.
quotes.author: David Hume

quotes.text: Be truthful, nature only sides with truth.
quotes.author: Adolf Loos

quotes.text: The man who interprets Nature is always held in great honor.
quotes.author: Zora Neale Hurston

quotes.text: When I was growing up, Dr. Seuss was really my favorite. There was something about the lyrical nature and the simplicity of his work that really hit me.
quotes.author: Tim Burton

quotes.text: I did not want to be a tree, a flower or a wave. In a dancer's body, we as audience must see ourselves, not the imitated behavior of everyday actions, not the phenomenon of nature, not exotic creatures from another planet, but something of the miracle that is a human being.
quotes.author: Martha Graham

quotes.text: When a man and a woman have an overwhelming passion for each other, it seems to me, in spite of such obstacles dividing them as parents or husband, that they belong to each other in the name of Nature, and are lovers by Divine right, in spite of human convention or the laws.
quotes.author: Nicolas Chamfort

quotes.text: He who asks of life nothing but the improvement of his own nature... is less liable than anyone else to miss and waste life.
quotes.author: Henri Frederic Amiel

quotes.text: The nature of God is a circle of which the center is everywhere and the circumference is nowhere.
quotes.author: Empedocles

quotes.text: It is not human nature we should accuse but the despicable conventions that pervert it.
quotes.author: Denis Diderot

quotes.text: Our observation of nature must be diligent, our reflection profound, and our experiments exact. We rarely see these three means combined and for this reason, creative geniuses are not common.
quotes.author: Denis Diderot

quotes.text: Nature is neutral.
quotes.author: Adlai E. Stevenson

quotes.text: Every formula which expresses a law of nature is a hymn of praise to God.
quotes.author: Maria Mitchell

quotes.text: Ultimately, all human activities have as their goal the realization of happiness. Why, then, have we ended up producing the opposite result? Could the underlying cause be our failure to correctly understand the true nature of happiness?
quotes.author: Daisaku Ikeda

quotes.text: I think it's a very firm part of human nature that if you surround yourself with like-minded people, you'll end up thinking more extreme versions of what you thought before.
quotes.author: Cass Sunstein

quotes.text: Age is not measured by years. Nature does not equally distribute energy. Some people are born old and tired while others are going strong at seventy.
quotes.author: Dorothy Thompson

quotes.text: Nature can do more than physicians.
quotes.author: Oliver Cromwell

quotes.text: To me, the world's rather beautiful if you look at it. Especially nature.
quotes.author: David Hockney

quotes.text: To enter by reason means to realize the essence through instruction and to believe that all living things share the same true nature, which isn't apparent because it's shrouded by sensation and delusion.
quotes.author: Bodhidharma

quotes.text: Your nature is the Buddha.
quotes.author: Bodhidharma

quotes.text: Save for the wild force of Nature, nothing moves in this world that is not Greek in its origin.
quotes.author: Lord Acton

quotes.text: None of us is responsible for the complexion of his skin. This fact of nature offers no clue to the character or quality of the person underneath.
quotes.author: Marian Anderson

quotes.text: A hatred of failure has always been part of my nature.
quotes.author: Paul Getty

quotes.text: There is nothing more corrupting, nothing more destructive of the noblest and finest feelings of our nature, than the exercise of unlimited power.
quotes.author: William Henry Harrison

quotes.text: The essence of the Hebrew Bible, transmitted by Christianity, is separation: between life and death, nature and God, good and evil, man and woman, and the holy and the profane.
quotes.author: Dennis Prager

quotes.text: Controversy is part of the nature of art and creativity.
quotes.author: Yoko Ono

quotes.text: In the world of words, the imagination is one of the forces of nature.
quotes.author: Wallace Stevens

quotes.text: God created the world the laws of nature were created by God. True science tries to find out what God put in the world. The trouble is where scientists speculate about theology and they don't know what they're talking about because they weren't there. They can't speculate about the origins of life because they weren't there.
quotes.author: Pat Robertson

quotes.text: In antiquity the sage kings recognized that men's nature is bad and that their tendencies were not being corrected and their lawlessness controlled.
quotes.author: Xun Zi

quotes.text: The creative destruction that social media is currently unleashing will change more than technology or the leader board of the Fortune 100. It is driving a qualitative shift in the nature of relationships between brands and their customers.
quotes.author: Simon Mainwaring

quotes.text: To say to the painter that Nature is to be taken as she is, is to say to the player that he may sit on the piano.
quotes.author: James Whistler

quotes.text: It is the nature of the self to manifest itself, In every atom slumbers the might of the self.
quotes.author: Muhammad Iqbal

quotes.text: It's incredible how nature sets females up to take care of people, and yet it is tricky for them to take care of themselves.
quotes.author: Bjork

quotes.text: Nature, I have constantly argued in my work, is the real superpower of this godless universe. It is the ultimate disposer of human fate, randomly recarving geography over 10,000-year epochs.
quotes.author: Camille Paglia

quotes.text: High Romanticism shows you nature in all its harsh and lovely metamorphoses. Flood, fire and quake fling us back to the primal struggle for survival and reveal our gross dependency on mammoth, still mysterious forces.
quotes.author: Camille Paglia

quotes.text: I have never been able to grasp the meaning of time. I don't believe it exists. I've felt this again and again, when alone and out in nature. On such occasions, time does not exist. Nor does the future exist.
quotes.author: Thor Heyerdahl

quotes.text: Literature is the expression of a feeling of deprivation, a recourse against a sense of something missing. But the contrary is also true: language is what makes us human. It is a recourse against the meaningless noise and silence of nature and history.
quotes.author: Octavio Paz

quotes.text: An argument fatal to the communist theory, is suggested by the fact, that a desire for property is one of the elements of our nature.
quotes.author: Herbert Spencer

quotes.text: There is something mean in human nature that prefers to think evil, that gives a willing ear and a ready welcome to calumny, a sort of jealousy of goodness and greatness and things of good report.
quotes.author: Richard Le Gallienne

quotes.text: The art of healing comes from nature, not from the physician. Therefore the physician must start from nature, with an open mind.
quotes.author: Paracelsus

quotes.text: The private citizen, beset by partisan appeals for the loan of his Public Opinion, will soon see, perhaps, that these appeals are not a compliment to his intelligence, but an imposition on his good nature and an insult to his sense of evidence.
quotes.author: Walter Lippmann

quotes.text: I'm so not stylish by nature, but I've learned to work with what I have.
quotes.author: Julie Bowen

quotes.text: Cruelty is the law pervading all nature and society and we can't get out of it if we would.
quotes.author: Thomas Hardy

quotes.text: We don't do things we aren't good at by nature. I wouldn't play basketball because I'm only 5' 1". Find what you enjoy - whether it's racing, flying a helicopter, being a doctor, or stitching clothes together. Once you've done that, you have the passion you need.
quotes.author: Danica Patrick

quotes.text: I think that the best way to explain that is that my mother gave me all the color and character and flare and liveliness, and my father gave me all the sanity and nature and all the things that helped me be a more rounded human being.
quotes.author: Julie Andrews

quotes.text: A desire to resist oppression is implanted in the nature of man.
quotes.author: Tacitus

quotes.text: When you look at Japanese traditional architecture, you have to look at Japanese culture and its relationship with nature. You can actually live in a harmonious, close contact with nature - this very unique to Japan.
quotes.author: Tadao Ando

quotes.text: Wars will remain while human nature remains. I believe in my soul in cooperation, in arbitration but the soldier's occupation we cannot say is gone until human nature is gone.
quotes.author: Rutherford B. Hayes

quotes.text: The law cannot equalize mankind in spite of nature.
quotes.author: Luc de Clapiers

quotes.text: I don't stop. It's my nature. People have to tell me to slow down. I plan on playing every role on Broadway. I want to do 'Evita.' I want to do 'Sweeney Todd' with Chris Colfer. We want to do 'Wicked.' I'll be Elphaba and he wants to play 'Guy-linda.' I want to do movies, make music. 'Glee' is only the beginning.
quotes.author: Lea Michele

quotes.text: Art is nature speeded up and God slowed down.
quotes.author: Malcolm De Chazal

quotes.text: Every corny thing that's said about living with nature - being in harmony with the earth, feeling the cycle of the seasons - happens to be true.
quotes.author: Susan Orlean

quotes.text: Nature's music is never over her silences are pauses, not conclusions.
quotes.author: Mary Webb

quotes.text: There are no lines in nature, only areas of colour, one against another.
quotes.author: Edouard Manet

quotes.text: The beautiful spring came and when Nature resumes her loveliness, the human soul is apt to revive also.
quotes.author: Harriet Ann Jacobs

quotes.text: The stars, that nature hung in heaven, and filled their lamps with everlasting oil, give due light to the misled and lonely traveller.
quotes.author: John Milton

quotes.text: It often happens that when a person possesses a particular ability to an extraordinary degree, nature makes up for it by leaving him or her incompetent in every other department.
quotes.author: Robert Shea

quotes.text: You can tell the nature of the man by the words he chooses.
quotes.author: Edwin Louis Cole

quotes.text: Mother Nature comes up against reality, and the reality is that the system doesn't work.
quotes.author: John Garamendi

quotes.text: The body is ready to have babies. Nature wants it done then, when the body can handle it, not after 40, when the income can handle it.
quotes.author: Toni Morrison

quotes.text: The diversity of the phenomena of nature is so great, and the treasures hidden in the heavens so rich, precisely in order that the human mind shall never be lacking in fresh nourishment.
quotes.author: Johannes Kepler

quotes.text: We are more than just flesh and bones. There's a certain spiritual nature and something of the mind that we can't measure. We can't find it. With all our sophisticated equipment, we cannot monitor or define it, and yet it's there.
quotes.author: Benjamin Carson

quotes.text: Nature is a petrified magic city.
quotes.author: Novalis

quotes.text: It is a law of human nature that in victory even the coward may boast of his prowess, while defeat injures the reputation even of the brave.
quotes.author: Sallust

quotes.text: The possibility of a scientific treatment of history means a wider experience, a greater maturity of practical reason, and finally a fuller realization of certain basic ideas regarding the nature of life and time.
quotes.author: Muhammad Iqbal

quotes.text: Cruelty is a part of nature, at least of human nature, but it is the one thing that seems unnatural to us.
quotes.author: Robinson Jeffers

quotes.text: The insufferable arrogance of human beings to think that Nature was made solely for their benefit, as if it was conceivable that the sun had been set afire merely to ripen men's apples and head their cabbages.
quotes.author: Cyrano de Bergerac

quotes.text: It is in the very nature of things human that every act that has once made its appearance and has been recorded in the history of mankind stays with mankind as a potentiality long after its actuality has become a thing of the past.
quotes.author: Hannah Arendt

quotes.text: Of all those arts in which the wise excel, Nature's chief masterpiece is writing well.
quotes.author: Andre Breton

quotes.text: One learns more from listening than speaking.And both the wind and the people who continue to live close to nature still have much to tell us which we cannot hear within university walls.
quotes.author: Thor Heyerdahl

quotes.text: No further evidence is needed to show that 'mental illness' is not the name of a biological condition whose nature awaits to be elucidated, but is the name of a concept whose purpose is to obscure the obvious.
quotes.author: Thomas Szasz

quotes.text: Those who made and endorsed our Constitution knew man's nature, and it is to their ideas, rather than to the temptations of utopia, that we must ask that our judges adhere.
quotes.author: Robert Bork

quotes.text: Never does nature say one thing and wisdom another.
quotes.author: Juvenal

quotes.text: Nothing is too wonderful to be true if it be consistent with the laws of nature.
quotes.author: Michael Faraday

quotes.text: If journalism is good, it is controversial, by its nature.
quotes.author: Julian Assange

quotes.text: Poetry is emotion put into measure. The emotion must come by nature, but the measure can be acquired by art.
quotes.author: Thomas Hardy

quotes.text: Conservatives sense a link between television and drugs, but they do not grasp the nature of this connection.
quotes.author: Christopher Lasch

quotes.text: A true man never frets about his place in the world, but just slides into it by the gravitation of his nature, and swings there as easily as a star.
quotes.author: Edwin Hubbel Chapin

quotes.text: I've been very competitive by nature from a young age, whether it was eating a bowl of pasta faster than somebody else, or always wanting to be the first one in line.
quotes.author: Maria Sharapova

quotes.text: I believe that laughter is the best emotional Band-Aid in the world. It's like nature's Neosporin.
quotes.author: Matt LeBlanc

quotes.text: Beauty is grace and confidence. I've learned to accept and appreciate what nature gave me.
quotes.author: Lindsay Lohan

quotes.text: All a musician can do is to get closer to the sources of nature, and so feel that he is in communion with the natural laws.
quotes.author: John Coltrane

quotes.text: Nature is the master of talents genius is the master of nature.
quotes.author: J. G. Holland

quotes.text: Many people believe that they are attracted by God, or by Nature, when they are only repelled by man.
quotes.author: William Ralph Inge

quotes.text: The courage of a soldier is found to be the cheapest and most common quality of human nature.
quotes.author: Edward Gibbon

quotes.text: Is there some principal of nature which states that we never know the quality of what we have until it is gone?
quotes.author: Herman Melville

quotes.text: In the beginning you must subject yourself to the influence of nature. You must be able to walk firmly on the ground before you start walking on a tightrope.
quotes.author: Henri Matisse

quotes.text: Plot, rules, nor even poetry, are not half so great beauties in tragedy or comedy as a just imitation of nature, of character, of the passions and their operations in diversified situations.
quotes.author: Horace Walpole

quotes.text: I often get letters, quite frequently, from people who say how they like the programmes a lot, but I never give credit to the almighty power that created nature.
quotes.author: David Attenborough

quotes.text: The man who has sufficient power over himself to wait until his nature has recovered its even balance is the truly wise man, but such beings are seldom met with.
quotes.author: Giacomo Casanova

quotes.text: What I'm attempting to do is to show people that if I can spend some time with very dangerous spiders and snakes and scorpions, then maybe they'll feel different about the spiders and snakes they find around their areas. I don't need people to keep them as pets. I just like them to be respectful and see that everything in nature has its place.
quotes.author: Dominic Monaghan

quotes.text: It's human nature to start taking things for granted again when danger isn't banging loudly on the door.
quotes.author: David Hackworth

quotes.text: I used to be such a militant city-ist, but more and more I've seen forests and nature and oceans, and I don't know any more if this is the awesomest way to live.
quotes.author: Regina Spektor

quotes.text: There's a constantly applicable nature to soul music, whereas sometimes pop music can be a periodical.
quotes.author: John Mayer

quotes.text: Games, by nature, have more plot options and non-linear qualities than TV and film.
quotes.author: David Duchovny

quotes.text: I mean, you always want everybody to pat you on the back and tell you you're wonderful every time you do something I think that's human nature.
quotes.author: David Duchovny

quotes.text: We cannot remember too often that when we observe nature, and especially the ordering of nature, it is always ourselves alone we are observing.
quotes.author: Georg C. Lichtenberg

quotes.text: A good face they say, is a letter of recommendation. O Nature, Nature, why art thou so dishonest, as ever to send men with these false recommendations into the World!
quotes.author: Henry Fielding

quotes.text: What is called an acute knowledge of human nature is mostly nothing but the observer's own weaknesses reflected back from others.
quotes.author: Georg C. Lichtenberg

quotes.text: The Greeks possessed a knowledge of human nature we seem hardly able to attain to without passing through the strengthening hibernation of a new barbarism.
quotes.author: Georg C. Lichtenberg

quotes.text: It's just a part of our nature to hope.
quotes.author: Elizabeth Edwards

quotes.text: The artist is the confidant of nature, flowers carry on dialogues with him through the graceful bending of their stems and the harmoniously tinted nuances of their blossoms. Every flower has a cordial word which nature directs towards him.
quotes.author: Auguste Rodin

quotes.text: I've probably understood men too well. I realise they are predatory by nature, and I have a certain acceptance of the male animal.
quotes.author: Jacqueline Bisset

quotes.text: It was the full conviction of this, and of what could be done, if every man were placed in the office for which he was fitted by nature and a proper education, which first suggested to me the plan of Illumination.
quotes.author: Adam Weishaupt

quotes.text: No one likes to have less than they had before. That's the nature of the human animal.
quotes.author: Joni Mitchell

quotes.text: I'm a very analytical person, a somewhat introspective person that's the nature of the work I do.
quotes.author: Joni Mitchell

quotes.text: There are times as a parent when you realize that your job is not to be the parent you always imagined you'd be, the parent you always wished you had. Your job is to be the parent your child needs, given the particulars of his or her own life and nature.
quotes.author: Ayelet Waldman

quotes.text: The thing that gave me the most pain in life, psychologically, and it gave me tremendous pain psychologically, is man's disrespect for nature.
quotes.author: Joni Mitchell

quotes.text: I pity the young woman who will attempt to insinuate herself between my mama's boy and me. I sympathize with the monumental nature of her task. It will take a crowbar, two bulldozers and half a dozen Molotov cocktails to pry my Oedipus and me loose from one another.
quotes.author: Ayelet Waldman

quotes.text: Human nature is not black and white but black and grey.
quotes.author: Graham Greene

quotes.text: Dreams come true without that possibility, nature would not incite us to have them.
quotes.author: John Updike

quotes.text: Greed is a basic part of animal nature. Being against it is like being against breathing or eating. It means nothing.
quotes.author: Ben Stein

quotes.text: The whole order of nature evinces a progressive march towards a higher life.
quotes.author: H. P. Blavatsky

quotes.text: A poem need not have a meaning and like most things in nature often does not have.
quotes.author: Wallace Stevens

quotes.text: I'd love to go back to Europe in the '20s and '30s, for the beginning of the Psychoanalytic Movement, and Freud and Jung, and all that was going on with discoveries in quantum physics. The whole nature of reality was changing and being challenged.
quotes.author: Michael Sheen

quotes.text: Sound is the vocabulary of nature.
quotes.author: Pierre Schaeffer

quotes.text: Many difficulties which nature throws in our way, may be smoothed away by the exercise of intelligence.
quotes.author: Titus Livius

quotes.text: Human judges can show mercy. But against the laws of nature, there is no appeal.
quotes.author: Arthur C. Clarke

quotes.text: Now it is human nature to want to eat to ones fill when hungry, to want to warm up when cold, to want to rest when tired. These all are a part of people's emotional nature.
quotes.author: Xun Zi

quotes.text: I am more and more convinced that our happiness or our unhappiness depends far more on the way we meet the events of life than on the nature of those events themselves.
quotes.author: Wilhelm von Humboldt

quotes.text: Go forth under the open sky, and list To Nature's teachings.
quotes.author: William C. Bryant

quotes.text: Human nature is such that monogamy is a really hard thing to achieve.
quotes.author: Sienna Miller

quotes.text: Whatsoever is contrary to nature is contrary to reason, and whatsoever is contrary to reason is absurd.
quotes.author: Baruch Spinoza

quotes.text: A committee is organic rather than mechanical in its nature: it is not a structure but a plant. It takes root and grows, it flowers, wilts, and dies, scattering the seed from which other committees will bloom in their turn.
quotes.author: C. Northcote Parkinson

quotes.text: Nothing in the universe is contingent, but all things are conditioned to exist and operate in a particular manner by the necessity of the divine nature.
quotes.author: Baruch Spinoza

quotes.text: Nature is something outside our body, but the mind is within us.
quotes.author: Bhumibol Adulyadej

quotes.text: And of all illumination which human reason can give, none is comparable to the discovery of what we are, our nature, our obligations, what happiness we are capable of, and what are the means of attaining it.
quotes.author: Adam Weishaupt

quotes.text: You want to put out a TV show? If you have the money to do it on your own, by yourself, and you have a TV network, you can do it by yourself. But the nature of the beast is, art needs finance. That's how this industry works. So until the Internet becomes our source of entertainment - and watch it, I believe it will - this is how things go.
quotes.author: Nathan Fillion

quotes.text: The scientific observer of Nature is a kind of mystic seeker in the act of prayer.
quotes.author: Muhammad Iqbal

quotes.text: Over-commercialization and its resulting restrictions and limitations can be very damaging and distorting to the inherent nature of the individual. I did not deliberately abandon my fans, nor did I deliberately abandon any responsibilities.
quotes.author: Lauryn Hill

quotes.text: I wish that all of nature's magnificence, the emotion of the land, the living energy of place could be photographed.
quotes.author: Annie Leibovitz

quotes.text: I can tell you for sure: people who are at their peak right now will not sustain that. You can't. It's against the law of nature.
quotes.author: Bryan Cranston

quotes.text: Compared to America or Europe, God isn't a big part of our lives here. I don't know anyone here who goes to church when he's had a rough divorce or is going through depression. We go out into nature instead.
quotes.author: Bjork

quotes.text: Don't be afraid in nature: one must be bold, at the risk of having been deceived and making mistakes.
quotes.author: Camille Pissarro

quotes.text: To bare our souls is all we ask, to give all we have to life and the beings surrounding us. Here the nature spirits are intense and we appreciate them, make offerings to them - these nature spirits who call us here - sealing our fate with each other, celebrating our love.
quotes.author: Alex Grey

quotes.text: A civilized nation can have no enemies, and one cannot draw a line across a map, a line that doesn't even exist in nature and say that the ugly enemy lives on the one side, and good friends live on the other.
quotes.author: Thor Heyerdahl

quotes.text: Nothing in human nature is so God-like as the disposition to do good to our fellow-creatures.
quotes.author: Samuel Richardson

quotes.text: Nothing. We're all friends and friendly. So when the cameras go down, depending on the mood or the nature of the material we're dealing with, there's usually a kind of a prevailing light attitude that's floating around.
quotes.author: Richard Dean Anderson

quotes.text: One of the greatest pains to human nature is the pain of a new idea.
quotes.author: Walter Bagehot

quotes.text: I never sort of thought of myself as a comedy writer, by nature.
quotes.author: Lena Dunham

quotes.text: Custom is second nature.
quotes.author: Augustine of Hippo

quotes.text: I attribute the quarrelsome nature of the Middle Ages young men entirely to the want of the soothing weed.
quotes.author: Jerome K. Jerome

quotes.text: I'm a typical middle child. I'm the mediator. The one that makes everything OK, puts their own needs aside to make sure everybody's happy. It's hard to change your nature, even with years and years of therapy.
quotes.author: Jennifer Jason Leigh

quotes.text: Ninety percent of the students take the 'preferred lender.' Why? Because that's the nature of the relationship. You trust the school. The school is in a position of authority.
quotes.author: Andrew Cuomo

quotes.text: The Republican form of government is the highest form of government: but because of this it requires the highest type of human nature, a type nowhere at present existing.
quotes.author: Herbert Spencer

quotes.text: The attitude that nature is chaotic and that the artist puts order into it is a very absurd point of view, I think. All that we can hope for is to put some order into ourselves.
quotes.author: Willem de Kooning

quotes.text: English majors understand human nature better than economists do.
quotes.author: Jane Smiley

quotes.text: Close elections tend to break toward the challenger because undecided voters - having held out so long against the incumbent - are by nature looking for change.
quotes.author: Ron Fournier

quotes.text: Is human nature basically good or evil? No economist can embark upon his profession without considering this question, and yet they all seem to. And they all seem to think human nature is basically good, or they wouldn't be surprised by the effects of deregulation.
quotes.author: Jane Smiley

quotes.text: People have always wanted to be recognized, and that's human nature. But people used to want to be recognized for their accomplishments, and now they simply want to be visible.
quotes.author: Diablo Cody

quotes.text: There can never be such a thing as a free market, because it is human nature to cheat, monopolize, and buy off others so as to corner the market.
quotes.author: Jane Smiley

quotes.text: We can't blame children for occupying themselves with Facebook rather than playing in the mud. Our society doesn't put a priority on connecting with nature. In fact, too often we tell them it's dirty and dangerous.
quotes.author: David Suzuki

quotes.text: Human nature doesn't include all human beings. There are human beings who are indifferent to politics, religion, virtually anything.
quotes.author: Conor Cruise O'Brien

quotes.text: As parents, grandparents, uncles and aunts we need to start getting out into nature with the young people in our lives. Families play a key role in getting kids outside.
quotes.author: David Suzuki

quotes.text: I think it is in collaboration that the nature of art is revealed.
quotes.author: Steve Lacy

quotes.text: I've always regarded nature as the clothing of God.
quotes.author: Alan Hovhaness

quotes.text: Nature never said to me: Do not be poor still less did she say: Be rich her cry to me was always: Be independent.
quotes.author: Nicolas Chamfort

quotes.text: While a case can be made for intelligent design, I can't figure out why some Christians are so thrilled about that possibility. First of all, it doesn't prove there's a God. If anything, intelligent design lends support to some form of pantheism that defines God as immanent within nature.
quotes.author: Tony Campolo

quotes.text: There is no doubt that religion had already waned under the onslaught of the Enlightenment, but it was Freud who provided the radically new understanding of human nature that made any religious explanation of the whats and whys of our personhood seem naive.
quotes.author: Tony Campolo

quotes.text: The Ukrainian community is tight-knit by nature.
quotes.author: Vera Farmiga

quotes.text: Women, by their nature, are not exceptional chess players: they are not great fighters.
quotes.author: Garry Kasparov

quotes.text: The structure of life I have described in buildings - the structure which I believe to be objective - is deeply and inextricably connected with the human person, and with the innermost nature of human feeling.
quotes.author: Christopher Alexander

quotes.text: Listen, if there's one sure-fire rule that I have learned in this business, it's that I don't know anything about human nature.
quotes.author: Francis Ford Coppola

quotes.text: I realise that in this undertaking I place myself in a certain opposition to views widely held concerning the mathematical infinite and to opinions frequently defended on the nature of numbers.
quotes.author: Georg Cantor

quotes.text: The skull is nature's sculpture.
quotes.author: David Bailey

quotes.text: Anyone who has obeyed nature by transmitting a piece of gossip experiences the explosive relief that accompanies the satisfying of a primary need.
quotes.author: Primo Levi

quotes.text: Self-preservation, nature's first great law, all the creatures, except man, doth awe.
quotes.author: Andrew Marvell

quotes.text: The highest purpose is to have no purpose at all. This puts one in accord with nature, in her manner of operation.
quotes.author: John Cage

quotes.text: It is hard, I submit, to loathe bloodshed, including war, more than I do, but it is still harder to exceed my loathing of the very nature of totalitarian states in which massacre is only an administrative detail.
quotes.author: Vladimir Nabokov

quotes.text: A lawn is nature under totalitarian rule.
quotes.author: Michael Pollan

quotes.text: Hidden nature is secret God.
quotes.author: Sri Aurobindo

quotes.text: If you are cast in a different mould to the majority, it is no merit of yours: Nature did it.
quotes.author: Charlotte Bronte

quotes.text: To make a love story, you need a couple of young people, but to reflect on the nature of love, you're better off with old ones. That is a fact of life and literature - and of the novel ever since it fell in love with love in the 18th century.
quotes.author: James Buchan

quotes.text: It is human nature to instinctively rebel at obscurity or ordinariness.
quotes.author: Taylor Caldwell

quotes.text: The exposed nature of life in the public square affects leaders' attitudes toward risk - and failure.
quotes.author: Dee Dee Myers

quotes.text: Nature isn't positive in that way. It doesn't aim itself at you. It's not being unkind to you.
quotes.author: David Attenborough

quotes.text: Abstraction is real, probably more real than nature.
quotes.author: Josef Albers

quotes.text: Most of us really aren't horribly unique. There are 6 billion of us. Put 'em all in one room and very few would stand out as individuals. So maybe we ought to think of worth in terms of our ability to get along as a part of nature, rather than being the lords over nature.
quotes.author: Herbert Simon

quotes.text: We lament the speed of our society and the lack of depth and the nature of disposable information.
quotes.author: David Ogden Stiers

quotes.text: Such is the audacity of man, that he hath learned to counterfeit Nature, yea, and is so bold as to challenge her in her work.
quotes.author: Pliny the Elder

quotes.text: Faith is not a notion, but a real strong essential hunger, an attracting or magnetic desire of Christ, which as it proceeds from a seed of the divine nature in us, so it attracts and unites with its like.
quotes.author: William Law

quotes.text: I'm very comfortable with the nature of life and death, and that we come to an end. What's most difficult to imagine is that those dreams and early yearnings and desires of childhood and adolescence will also disappear. But who knows? Maybe you become part of the eternal whatever.
quotes.author: Hugh Hefner

quotes.text: The gifts of nature are infinite in their variety, and mind differs from mind almost as much as body from body.
quotes.author: Quintilian

quotes.text: I don't think I'll ever be able to stay in one place for more than a year or two. It's not in my nature.
quotes.author: Ricky Williams

quotes.text: Government is, by its very nature, a destroyer of liberties the Obama administration, specifically, is promising to interfere with the economy and the health care system so profoundly that Washington will soon have us all in chains.
quotes.author: Thomas Frank

quotes.text: Compassion is a call, a demand of nature, to relieve the unhappy as hunger is a natural call for food.
quotes.author: Joseph Butler

quotes.text: The idea is that there is a kind of memory in nature. Each kind of thing has a collective memory. So, take a squirrel living in New York now. That squirrel is being influenced by all past squirrels.
quotes.author: Rupert Sheldrake

quotes.text: Nature chooses who will be transgender individuals don't choose this.
quotes.author: Mercedes Ruehl

quotes.text: Learn from me, if not by my precepts, then by my example, how dangerous is the pursuit of knowledge and how much happier is that man who believes his native town to be the world than he who aspires to be greater than his nature will allow.
quotes.author: Mary Wollstonecraft

quotes.text: If you can't be in awe of Mother Nature, there's something wrong with you.
quotes.author: Alex Trebek

quotes.text: The nature of the global business environment guarantees that no matter how hard we work to create a stable and healthy organisation, our organisation will continue to experience dramatic changes far beyond our control.
quotes.author: Margaret J. Wheatley

quotes.text: There is an urgent need for a radical revision of our current concepts of the nature of consciousness and its relationship to matter and the brain.
quotes.author: Stanislav Grof

quotes.text: Quantum computation is... a distinctively new way of harnessing nature... It will be the first technology that allows useful tasks to be performed in collaboration between parallel universes.
quotes.author: David Deutsch

quotes.text: Here take back the stuff that I am, nature, knead it back into the dough of being, make of me a bush, a cloud, whatever you will, even a man, only no longer make me me.
quotes.author: Georg C. Lichtenberg

quotes.text: Many artists and scholars have pointed out that ultimately art depends on human nature.
quotes.author: Steven Pinker

quotes.text: The noble simplicity in the works of nature only too often originates in the noble shortsightedness of him who observes it.
quotes.author: Georg C. Lichtenberg

quotes.text: Nature is not only all that is visible to the eye... it also includes the inner pictures of the soul.
quotes.author: Edvard Munch

quotes.text: For neither life nor nature cares if justice is ever done or not.
quotes.author: Patricia Highsmith

quotes.text: A beautiful lady is an accident of nature. A beautiful old lady is a work of art.
quotes.author: Louis Nizer

quotes.text: Although believers by nature, are far from God, and children of wrath, even as others, yet it is amazing to think how nigh they are brought to him again by the blood of Jesus Christ.
quotes.author: George Whitefield

quotes.text: I don't understand the notion that modern farming is anything do to with nature. It's a pretty gross interference with nature.
quotes.author: Peter Singer

quotes.text: Art is about expressing the true nature of the human spirit in whatever way one wishes to express it. If it is honest, it is beautiful. If it is not honest, it is obvious.
quotes.author: Corin Nemec

quotes.text: Resistance is feasible even for those who are not heroes by nature, and it is an obligation, I believe, for those who fear the consequences and detest the reality of the attempt to impose American hegemony.
quotes.author: Noam Chomsky

quotes.text: Beauty is nature's brag, and must be shown in courts, at feasts, and high solemnities, where most may wonder at the workmanship.
quotes.author: John Milton

quotes.text: Nature abhors a vacuum.
quotes.author: Francois Rabelais

quotes.text: I think most artists create out of despair. The very nature of creation is not a performing glory on the outside, it's a painful, difficult search within.
quotes.author: Louise Berliawsky Nevelson

quotes.text: I can find God in nature, in animals, in birds and the environment.
quotes.author: Pat Buckley

quotes.text: But theater, because of its nature, both text, images, multimedia effects, has a wider base of communication with an audience. That's why I call it the most social of the various art forms.
quotes.author: Wole Soyinka

quotes.text: Love of man for woman - love of woman for man. That's the nature, the meaning, the best of life itself.
quotes.author: Zane Grey

quotes.text: There's a kind of dynamic quality about theater and that dynamic quality expresses itself in relation to, first of all, the environment in which it's being staged then the audience, the nature of the audience, the quality of the audience.
quotes.author: Wole Soyinka

quotes.text: Whenever I get fed up with life I love to go wandering in nature.
quotes.author: Andrea Arnold

quotes.text: Human nature is above all things lazy.
quotes.author: Harriet Beecher Stowe

quotes.text: We coin concepts and we use them to analyse and explain nature and society. But we seem to forget, midway, that these concepts are our own constructs and start equating them with reality.
quotes.author: Abdolkarim Soroush

quotes.text: Growing hemp as nature designed it is vital to our urgent need to reduce greenhouse gases and ensure the survival of our planet.
quotes.author: Jack Herer

quotes.text: The scientist does not study nature because it is useful he studies it because he delights in it, and he delights in it because it is beautiful.
quotes.author: Henri Poincare

quotes.text: By nature, men love newfangledness.
quotes.author: Geoffrey Chaucer

quotes.text: In the state of nature profit is the measure of right.
quotes.author: Thomas Hobbes

quotes.text: I plead for conservation of human culture, which is much more fragile than nature herself. We needn't destroy other cultures with the force of our own.
quotes.author: Arthur Erickson

quotes.text: I love romantic comedies. They're for me the easiest thing to do and the most natural to do. There's nothing natural about holding an uzi hanging out of a moving van shooting at people. That's not second nature to me, thank God.
quotes.author: Gabrielle Union

quotes.text: No phenomenon can be isolated, but has repercussions through every aspect of our lives. We are learning that we are a fundamental part of nature's ecosystems.
quotes.author: Arthur Erickson

quotes.text: There is little doubt that we are in the midst of a revolution of a much more profound and fundamental nature than the social and political revolutions of the last half century.
quotes.author: Arthur Erickson

quotes.text: Each of us has a very rich nature and can look at things objectively, from a distance, and at the same time can have something more personal to say about them. I am trying to look at the world, and at myself, from many different points of view. I think many poets have this duality.
quotes.author: Wislawa Szymborska

quotes.text: Mencius said that human nature is good. I disagree with that.
quotes.author: Xun Zi

quotes.text: We must make it an imperative duty of our government to protect the gifts which Nature has bestowed on America and to insure the maintenance of a clean, healthy, wholesome environment for our people.
quotes.author: George Lincoln Rockwell

quotes.text: Thus, anybody who follows this nature and gives way its states will be led into quarrels and conflicts, and go against the conventions and rules of society, and will end up a criminal.
quotes.author: Xun Zi

quotes.text: Human nature is such that people are born with a love of profit If they follow these inclinations, they will struggle and snatch from each other, and inclinations to defer or yield will die.
quotes.author: Xun Zi

quotes.text: I believe the accepted model of capitalism that demands endless growth deserves the blame for the destruction of nature, and it should be displaced. Failing that, I try to work with those companies and help them change the way they think about our resources.
quotes.author: Yvon Chouinard

quotes.text: When I get recognized for 'Twilight,' it's usually a teenage girl, and they're usually really loud. So it certainly feels like I get recognized the most from that, but it could just be because of the nature of how vocal those fans are.
quotes.author: Anna Kendrick

quotes.text: Since the nature of people is bad, to become corrected they must be taught by teachers and to be orderly they must acquire ritual and moral principles.
quotes.author: Xun Zi

quotes.text: I like figuring out where I need to be mentally so that I'm not thinking about the camera and that it's second nature. I want to get to a place where I can exist within the confines of what you can do with filmmaking and not have to think about it.
quotes.author: Anna Kendrick

quotes.text: Human nature is what Heaven supplies.
quotes.author: Xun Zi

quotes.text: Human nature refers to what is in people but which they cannot study or work at achieving.
quotes.author: Xun Zi

quotes.text: It's a great event to get outside and enjoy nature. I find it very exciting no matter how many times I see bald eagles.
quotes.author: Karen Armstrong

quotes.text: Some people just use beautiful things to just shop or to have a tribal feeling - 'Oh, blah, blah, blah, I'm wearing Hermes blah, blah, blah, I'm wearing Saint Laurent blah-blah blah' - because it's like a need, a tribe, recognition: 'Ahh, my Rolex.' But I run away from anything which is too recognizable - it's my nature.
quotes.author: Manolo Blahnik

quotes.text: French is a foreign language, but I've been speaking it since I was 18 so it's second nature to me.
quotes.author: Kristin Scott Thomas

quotes.text: The laws of nature are but the mathematical thoughts of God.
quotes.author: Euclid

quotes.text: I would warn you that I do not attribute to nature either beauty or deformity, order or confusion. Only in relation to our imagination can things be called beautiful or ugly, well-ordered or confused.
quotes.author: Baruch Spinoza

quotes.text: Only that thing is free which exists by the necessities of its own nature, and is determined in its actions by itself alone.
quotes.author: Baruch Spinoza

quotes.text: I think there's a supreme power behind the whole thing, an intelligence. Look at all of the instincts of nature, both animals and plants, the very ingenious ways they survive. If you cut yourself, you don't have to think about it.
quotes.author: Clyde Tombaugh

quotes.text: Nothing exists from whose nature some effect does not follow.
quotes.author: Baruch Spinoza

quotes.text: Every man should follow the bent of his nature in art and letters, always provided that he does not offend against the rules of morality and good taste.
quotes.author: Thomas Edward Brown

quotes.text: Speech is human nature itself, with none of the artificiality of written language.
quotes.author: Alfred North Whitehead

quotes.text: Since those who believe they need a hero/celebrity outnumber the actual heroes/celebrities, people feel safe and comfortably justified in numbers, committing egregious crimes in the name of the greater social ego. Ironically diminishing their own true hero-celebrity nature in the process.
quotes.author: Lauryn Hill

quotes.text: Assuming that man has a distinct spiritual nature, a soul, why should it be thought unnatural that under appropriate conditions of maladjustment, his soul might die before his body does or that his soul might die without his knowing it?
quotes.author: Albert J. Nock

quotes.text: The historic ascent of humanity, taken as a whole, may be summarized as a succession of victories of consciousness over blind forces - in nature, in society, in man himself.
quotes.author: Leon Trotsky

quotes.text: Natural science, does not simply describe and explain nature it is part of the interplay between nature and ourselves.
quotes.author: Werner Heisenberg

quotes.text: The fans know what's happened to me over the past couple of years. I lost my family. I pretty much got devastated financially and the fans know that I've had some hard times - and that's the nature of loyal fans. They want to see the people that they love and believe in get back on their feet.
quotes.author: Hulk Hogan

quotes.text: There were no temples or shrines among us save those of nature.
quotes.author: Charles Eastman

quotes.text: Nature says women are human beings, men have made religions to deny it. Nature says women are human beings, men cry out no!
quotes.author: Taslima Nasrin

quotes.text: There is no gardening without humility. Nature is constantly sending even its oldest scholars to the bottom of the class for some egregious blunder.
quotes.author: Alfred Austin

quotes.text: I found myself in a race with Mother Nature to play as much baseball as I could before she forced me to stop.
quotes.author: Willie Stargell

quotes.text: It's human nature to be curious about people, and to be more curious about young people than old people. We want to cheer something on at the same time we want to tear it down. That's just so normal.
quotes.author: Amy Grant

quotes.text: I have a bit of a rebellious nature.
quotes.author: John Cusack

quotes.text: To enjoy good health, to bring true happiness to one's family, to bring peace to all, one must first discipline and control one's own mind. If a man can control his mind he can find the way to Enlightenment, and all wisdom and virtue will naturally come to him.
quotes.author: Buddha

quotes.text: A child who is allowed to be disrespectful to his parents will not have true respect for anyone.
quotes.author: Billy Graham

quotes.text: We never know the love of a parent till we become parents ourselves.
quotes.author: Henry Ward Beecher

quotes.text: I cannot think of any need in childhood as strong as the need for a father's protection.
quotes.author: Sigmund Freud

quotes.text: Even as kids reach adolescence, they need more than ever for us to watch over them. Adolescence is not about letting go. It's about hanging on during a very bumpy ride.
quotes.author: Ron Taffel

quotes.text: Mothers all want their sons to grow up to be president, but they don't want them to become politicians in the process.
quotes.author: John F. Kennedy

quotes.text: A mother who is really a mother is never free.
quotes.author: Honore de Balzac

quotes.text: Children are educated by what the grown-up is and not by his talk.
quotes.author: Carl Jung

quotes.text: Let parents bequeath to their children not riches, but the spirit of reverence.
quotes.author: Plato

quotes.text: Each day of our lives we make deposits in the memory banks of our children.
quotes.author: Charles R. Swindoll

quotes.text: Mothers - especially single mothers - are heroic in their efforts to raise our nation's children, but men must also take responsibility for their children and recognize the impact they have on their families' well-being.
quotes.author: Evan Bayh

quotes.text: Parentage is a very important profession, but no test of fitness for it is ever imposed in the interest of the children.
quotes.author: George Bernard Shaw

quotes.text: A new father quickly learns that his child invariably comes to the bathroom at precisely the times when he's in there, as if he needed company. The only way for this father to be certain of bathroom privacy is to shave at the gas station.
quotes.author: Bill Cosby

quotes.text: Always kiss your children goodnight, even if they're already asleep.
quotes.author: H. Jackson Brown, Jr.

quotes.text: How pleasant it is for a father to sit at his child's board. It is like an aged man reclining under the shadow of an oak which he has planted.
quotes.author: Voltaire

quotes.text: The truth is that parents are not really interested in justice. They just want quiet.
quotes.author: Bill Cosby

quotes.text: Never lend your car to anyone to whom you have given birth.
quotes.author: Erma Bombeck

quotes.text: Every cliche about kids is true they grow up so quickly, you blink and they're gone, and you have to spend the time with them now. But that's a joy.
quotes.author: Liam Neeson

quotes.text: We are apt to forget that children watch examples better than they listen to preaching.
quotes.author: Roy L. Smith

quotes.text: Most children threaten at times to run away from home. This is the only thing that keeps some parents going.
quotes.author: Phyllis Diller

quotes.text: Telling a teenager the facts of life is like giving a fish a bath.
quotes.author: Arnold H. Glasow

quotes.text: Few things are more satisfying than seeing your children have teenagers of their own.
quotes.author: Doug Larson

quotes.text: Most American children suffer too much mother and too little father.
quotes.author: Gloria Steinem

quotes.text: At the end of the day, the most overwhelming key to a child's success is the positive involvement of parents.
quotes.author: Jane D. Hull

quotes.text: Don't try to make children grow up to be like you, or they may do it.
quotes.author: Russell Baker

quotes.text: Girls are the future mothers of our society, and it is important that we focus on their well-being.
quotes.author: Miriam Makeba

quotes.text: I think a dad has to make his daughter feel that he's genuinely interested in what she's going through.
quotes.author: Harry Connick, Jr.

quotes.text: Nothing you do for children is ever wasted. They seem not to notice us, hovering, averting our eyes, and they seldom offer thanks, but what we do for them is never wasted.
quotes.author: Garrison Keillor

quotes.text: There's really no point in having children if you're not going to be home enough to father them.
quotes.author: Anthony Edwards

quotes.text: Having children is like having a bowling alley installed in your brain.
quotes.author: Martin Mull

quotes.text: The well-being and welfare of children should always be our focus.
quotes.author: Todd Tiahrt

quotes.text: I had no idea that mothering my own child would be so healing to my own sadness from my childhood.
quotes.author: Susie Bright

quotes.text: To me luxury is to be at home with my daughter, and the occasional massage doesn't hurt.
quotes.author: Olivia Newton-John

quotes.text: Children that are raised in a home with a married mother and father consistently do better in every measure of well-being than their peers who come from divorced or step-parent, single-parent, cohabiting homes.
quotes.author: Todd Tiahrt

quotes.text: Children are our second chance to have a great parent-child relationship.
quotes.author: Laura Schlessinger

quotes.text: Loving a child doesn't mean giving in to all his whims to love him is to bring out the best in him, to teach him to love what is difficult.
quotes.author: Nadia Boulanger

quotes.text: A baby is born with a need to be loved - and never outgrows it.
quotes.author: Frank A. Clark

quotes.text: My mother protected me from the world and my father threatened me with it.
quotes.author: Quentin Crisp

quotes.text: My children are the reason I laugh, smile and want to get up every morning.
quotes.author: Gena Lee Nolin

quotes.text: I take my children everywhere, but they always find their way back home.
quotes.author: Robert Orben

quotes.text: The Internet is just bringing all kinds of information into the home. There's just a lot of distraction, a lot of competition for the parent's voice to resonate in the children's ears.
quotes.author: Phil McGraw

quotes.text: I have three daughters, so I can't be as tough as I want to be. When you have kids - especially daughters - they know how to work you. They're a lot smarter than we are, that's for sure. But I'll be more tough on their boyfriends.
quotes.author: Tim McGraw

quotes.text: The interesting thing about being a mother is that everyone wants pets, but no one but me cleans the kitty litter.
quotes.author: Meryl Streep

quotes.text: Having a baby changes the way you view your in-laws. I love it when they come to visit now. They can hold the baby and I can go out.
quotes.author: Matthew Broderick

quotes.text: I figure that if the children are alive when I get home, I've done my job.
quotes.author: Roseanne Barr

quotes.text: I want to have children, but my friends scare me. One of my friends told me she was in labor for 36 hours. I don't even want to do anything that feels good for 36 hours.
quotes.author: Rita Rudner

quotes.text: Love is staying up all night with a sick child - or a healthy adult.
quotes.author: David Frost

quotes.text: Childhood obesity is best tackled at home through improved parental involvement, increased physical exercise, better diet and restraint from eating.
quotes.author: Bob Filner

quotes.text: Parents should not smoke in order to discourage their kids from smoking. A child is more likely to smoke when they have been raised in the environment of a smoker.
quotes.author: Christy Turlington

quotes.text: There are only two lasting bequests we can hope to give our children. One of these is roots, the other, wings.
quotes.author: Hodding Carter

quotes.text: Studies show that children best flourish when one mom and one dad are there to raise them.
quotes.author: John Boehner

quotes.text: It's hard enough to work and raise a family when your kids are all healthy and relatively normal, but when you add on some kind of disability or disease, it can just be such a burden.
quotes.author: Patricia Heaton

quotes.text: You can learn many things from children. How much patience you have, for instance.
quotes.author: Franklin P. Jones

quotes.text: No fathers or mothers think their own children ugly.
quotes.author: Miguel de Cervantes

quotes.text: You have to support your children to have a healthy relationship.
quotes.author: Connie Sellecca

quotes.text: The child supplies the power but the parents have to do the steering.
quotes.author: Benjamin Spock

quotes.text: If you're asking your kids to exercise, then you better do it, too. Practice what you preach.
quotes.author: Bruce Jenner

quotes.text: It's a huge change for your body. You don't even want to look in the mirror after you've had a baby, because your stomach is just hanging there like a Shar-Pei.
quotes.author: Cindy Crawford

quotes.text: It is a sad commentary of our times when our young must seek advice and counsel from 'Dear Abby' instead of going to Mom and Dad.
quotes.author: Abigail Van Buren

quotes.text: Parenthood remains the greatest single preserve of the amateur.
quotes.author: Alvin Toffler

quotes.text: What good mothers and fathers instinctively feel like doing for their babies is usually best after all.
quotes.author: Benjamin Spock

quotes.text: Parenthood and family come first for me, and when I'm not working I'm cool with the Teletubbies.
quotes.author: Clive Owen

quotes.text: Success for me its to raise happy, healthy human beings.
quotes.author: Kelly LeBrock

quotes.text: The family teaches us about the importance of knowledge, education, hard work and effort. It teaches us about enjoying ourselves, having fun, keeping fit and healthy.
quotes.author: Kamisese Mara

quotes.text: My father wasn't really involved and my mom is the light in my life.
quotes.author: Marion Jones

quotes.text: I've said it before, but it's absolutely true: My mother gave me my drive, but my father gave me my dreams. Thanks to him, I could see a future.
quotes.author: Liza Minnelli

quotes.text: Fathers and mothers have lost the idea that the highest aspiration they might have for their children is for them to be wise... specialized competence and success are all that they can imagine.
quotes.author: Allan Bloom

quotes.text: Family life was wonderful. The streets were bleak. The playgrounds were bleak. But home was always warm. My mother and father had a great relationship. I always felt 'safe' there.
quotes.author: Robert Cormier

quotes.text: Parents were invented to make children happy by giving them something to ignore.
quotes.author: Ogden Nash

quotes.text: Family involvement is a valuable thing and playing together actively can be the '90s version of it. Instead of just watching, you can do it together... something we don't spend enough time on. We can motivate and excite each other about fitness.
quotes.author: Alan Thicke

quotes.text: Education, like neurosis, begins at home.
quotes.author: Milton Sapirstein

quotes.text: I feel very blessed to have two wonderful, healthy children who keep me completely grounded, sane and throw up on my shoes just before I go to an awards show just so I know to keep it real.
quotes.author: Reese Witherspoon

quotes.text: No one knows his true character until he has run out of gas, purchased something on the installment plan and raised an adolescent.
quotes.author: Marcelene Cox

quotes.text: I don't think children's inner feelings have changed. They still want a mother and father in the very same house they want places to play.
quotes.author: Beverly Cleary

quotes.text: There are 80 million moms in the United States. Forty million stay at home with their children.
quotes.author: Andrew Shue

quotes.text: I get whatever placidity I have from my father. But my mother taught me how to take it on the chin.
quotes.author: Norma Shearer

quotes.text: It's a great mistake, I think, to put children off with falsehoods and nonsense, when their growing powers of observation and discrimination excite in them a desire to know about things.
quotes.author: Anne Sullivan

quotes.text: I regret not having had more time with my kids when they were growing up.
quotes.author: Tina Turner

quotes.text: What feeling is so nice as a child's hand in yours? So small, so soft and warm, like a kitten huddling in the shelter of your clasp.
quotes.author: Marjorie Holmes

quotes.text: We expect teachers to handle teenage pregnancy, substance abuse, and the failings of the family. Then we expect them to educate our children.
quotes.author: John Sculley

quotes.text: I think I'm going to have to live vicariously through my daughter's rebellion because I certainly never did go through adolescence.
quotes.author: Brooke Shields

quotes.text: Do you want to be an artist and a writer, or a wife and a lover? With kids, your focus changes. I don't want to go to PTA meetings.
quotes.author: Stevie Nicks

quotes.text: Believe me, my children have more stamina than a power station.
quotes.author: Robbie Coltrane

quotes.text: That's my ideal day, time with my boys.
quotes.author: Kenny G

quotes.text: Mom and Dad would stay in bed on Sunday morning, but the kids would have to go to church.
quotes.author: Lynn Johnston

quotes.text: We criticize mothers for closeness. We criticize fathers for distance. How many of us have expected less from our fathers and appreciated what they gave us more? How many of us always let them off the hook?
quotes.author: Ellen Goodman

quotes.text: Home life's great, man. The kids are great, happy and healthy. I've reached this sort of wonderful precipice.
quotes.author: Ryan Phillippe

quotes.text: My mother was the influence in my life. She was strong she had great faith in the ultimate triumph of justice and hard work. She believed passionately in education.
quotes.author: John H. Johnson

quotes.text: We all have an interest in making sure teens grow up healthy and drug-free.
quotes.author: John Walters

quotes.text: I'd just as soon stay home and raise babies.
quotes.author: June Allyson

quotes.text: Mama and Daddy King represent the best in manhood and womanhood, the best in a marriage, the kind of people we are trying to become.
quotes.author: Coretta Scott King

quotes.text: My mom's a Catholic, and my dad's a Jew, and they didn't want anything to do with anything.
quotes.author: Isabelle Huppert

quotes.text: There are some great questions to ask your doctor. If he says 'no,' then you find yourself a different doctor. There really has to be a change in how we medically look at women at this time. I mean, this is not just baby gloom.
quotes.author: Marie Osmond

quotes.text: I wasn't very good about juggling family and my career. I was interested in who was coming to the children's birthday party, what my son was writing. I was thinking about Legos.
quotes.author: Jill Clayburgh

quotes.text: My father was a farmer and my mother was a farmer, but, my childhood was very good. I am very grateful for my childhood, because it was full of gladness and good humanity.
quotes.author: Roberto Benigni

quotes.text: No matter how calmly you try to referee, parenting will eventually produce bizarre behavior, and I'm not talking about the kids. Their behavior is always normal.
quotes.author: Bill Cosby

quotes.text: My childhood should have taught me lessons for my own fatherhood, but it didn't because parenting can only be learned by people who have no children.
quotes.author: Bill Cosby

quotes.text: Screaming at children over their grades, especially to the point of the child's tears, is child abuse, pure and simple. It's not funny and it's not good parenting. It is a crushing, scarring, disastrous experience for the child. It isn't the least bit funny.
quotes.author: Ben Stein

quotes.text: What lingers from the parent's individual past, unresolved or incomplete, often becomes part of her or his irrational parenting.
quotes.author: Virginia Satir

quotes.text: Autism is a neurological disorder. It's not caused by bad parenting. It's caused by, you know, abnormal development in the brain. The emotional circuits in the brain are abnormal. And there also are differences in the white matter, which is the brain's computer cables that hook up the different brain departments.
quotes.author: Temple Grandin

quotes.text: Parenting is one of the hardest jobs on earth.
quotes.author: Jennifer Aniston

quotes.text: I'm worried about parents who aren't parenting.
quotes.author: Barbara Bush

quotes.text: Of course, the ideal scenario for parenting is obviously two parents of a mature age.
quotes.author: Jennifer Aniston

quotes.text: The Golden Rule of Parenting is do unto your children as you wish your parents had done unto you!
quotes.author: Louise Hart

quotes.text: I would like to do another piece of fiction dealing with a number of issues: Lesbian parenting, the 1960's, and interracial relationships in the Lesbian and Gay community.
quotes.author: Audre Lorde

quotes.text: Parenting is the most important job on the planet next to keeping Gary Busey off the nation's highways.
quotes.author: Dennis Miller

quotes.text: Indeed - judicious, consistent parenting is a dream of mine. No judgements, learning space and listening carefully are my goals.
quotes.author: Emma Thompson

quotes.text: I thought that once we were out of the baby stage, parenting would be a breeze.
quotes.author: Tori Spelling

quotes.text: Kids are a great analogy. You want your kids to grow up, and you don't want your kids to grow up. You want your kids to become independent of you, but it's also a parent's worst nightmare: That they won't need you. It's like the real tragedy of parenting.
quotes.author: Jonathan Safran Foer

quotes.text: I barely have time for my own children. To adopt more children and not have time for them, that would be poor parenting on my part.
quotes.author: Mary J. Blige

quotes.text: Very often when you see families it's all perfect and neat, and parenting isn't like that. You do have constant negotiations. Things are ever developing and ever changing, and you constantly have to evaluate how you deal with your kids.
quotes.author: Clive Owen

quotes.text: We're living in a time when parenting is not at all mirroring the way I was parented. For me, I just followed my parents around on their errands when they were busy on the phone, I was quiet. It's a different kettle of fish these days: They run the house, and you listen to their music, and you go to their appointments.
quotes.author: Edie Falco

quotes.text: Don't reward bad behavior. It is one of the first rules of parenting. During the financial cataclysm of 2008, we said it differently. When we bailed out banks that had created their own misfortune, we called it a 'moral hazard,' because the bailout absolved the bank's bad acts and created an incentive for it to make the same bad loans again.
quotes.author: Eliot Spitzer

quotes.text: Women are individuals in parenting, and why not?
quotes.author: Erica Jong

quotes.text: While not impossible, it is especially challenging for teenage parents to develop bonds with their children. A high percent of them were themselves children of teenage parents and have never experienced appropriate parenting.
quotes.author: Jane Fonda

quotes.text: No, I've never wanted kids. But I do read about parenting a lot.
quotes.author: Fiona Apple

quotes.text: I'm trying to break any chain of negative parenting that I might have survived.
quotes.author: Eddie Vedder

quotes.text: My grandmother was a kind of Scarsdale, New York, society woman, best known in her day as the author of the 1959 book 'Growing Your Own Way: An Informal Guide for Teen-Agers' - this despite being a person whose parenting style made Joan Crawford's wire hangers look like pool noodles.
quotes.author: Sloane Crosley

quotes.text: Ah, the power of two. There's nothing quite like it. Especially when it comes to paying utility bills, parenting, cooking elaborate meals, purchasing a grown-up bed, jumping rope and lifting heavy machinery. The world favours pairs.
